etymologies: Old English spearwa, of Germanic origin

definitions: a small Old World bird related to the weaverbirds, typically with brown and gray plumage.

notes.text: Family Passeridae (or Ploceidae): four genera, in particular Passer, and many species, e.g. the cosmopolitan house sparrow (P. domesticus)

definitions: any of a number of birds that resemble true sparrows in size or color.

notes.text: an American bunting (many genera in the subfamily Emberizinae, family Emberizidae)
a waxbill, in particular the Java sparrow
